intro: Comesperma spathulatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often found in shrublands and is valued for its ornamental appeal. The species is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
